subject: Re: TestListener & TestResult question.
msgSnippet: ... Thanks a lot for your hint! In fact, I was thinking about deriving a class from TestCase with overriden run() method. But your way is more simple :)
messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., "Johannes Link" <john.link@g...> wrote:
> You have to use a test's run(TestResult) method, i.e.
> 1. get your test instance (suite or test case)
> 2. create a test result, e.g. new TestResult()
> 3. create your TestListener instance
> 4. call addTestListener() with your test listener instance.
> 5. call the run(TestResult) method on your test instance
>
> hope that helps,

Thanks a lot for your hint!

In fact, I was thinking about deriving a class from TestCase
with overriden run() method. But your way is more simple :)

> Johannes
>
> ----- Original Message -----
